title: chain not synced beyond EIP-155 replay-protection fork block

# ðŸ’Ž Issue

### Background

When I use geth as the execution layer and prysm as the consensus layer to synchronize ropsten, the prysm log always shows the following information, how can I solve this?

### Description

prysm log:

y execution chain ID: chain not synced beyond EIP-155 replay-protection fork block" prefix=powchain
time="2022-06-29 09:03:40" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=43 inbound=0 outbound=43 prefix=p2p
time="2022-06-29 09:04:40" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=44 inbound=0 outbound=44 prefix=p2p
time="2022-06-29 09:05:10" level=error msg="Could not connect to execution client endpoint: could not make initial request to verify execution chain ID: chain not synced beyond EIP-155 replay-protection fork block" prefix=powchain
time="2022-06-29 09:05:40" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=45 inbound=0 outbound=45 prefix=p2p
time="2022-06-29 09:06:40" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=45 inbound=0 outbound=45 prefix=p2p
time="2022-06-29 09:07:25" level=error msg="Could not connect to execution client endpoint: could not make initial request to verify execution chain ID: chain not synced beyond EIP-155 replay-protection fork block" prefix=powchain
time="2022-06-29 09:07:40" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=46 inbound=0 outbound=46 prefix=p2p
time="2022-06-29 09:08:40" level=info msg="Peer summary" activePeers=45 inbound=0 outbound=45 prefix=p2p
time="2022-06-29 09:09:40" level=error msg="Could not connect to execution client endpoint: could not make initial request to verify execution chain ID: chain not synced beyond EIP-155 replay-protection fork block" prefix=powchain

geth log:

INFO [06-29|09:21:31.705] State sync in progress                   synced=70.95% state=41.74GiB accounts=230,697,717@6.41GiB slots=137,811,744@28.65GiB codes=1,267,483@6.67GiB  eta=6h0m43.915s

WARN [06-29|09:21:31.747] Unexpected bytecode packet               peer=0324bf10 reqid=6,616,886,557,082,279,966
WARN [06-29|09:21:31.775] Unexpected storage ranges packet         peer=139fa632 reqid=6,946,866,827,372,460,977

INFO [06-29|09:21:34.022] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=12,350,713 hash=4e8451..5809f6 td=50,001,647,293,494,169 ttd=50,000,000,000,000,000
INFO [06-29|09:21:34.259] State sync in progress                   synced=70.95% state=41.74GiB accounts=230,714,828@6.41GiB slots=137,811,744@28.65GiB codes=1,267,483@6.67GiB  eta=6h0m41.362s


start commandï¼š

version: "3"
services:
  prysm:
    image: gcr.dockerproxy.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:v2.1.3-rc.4
    container_name: ropsten-prysm-test
    restart: unless-stopped
    command: --datadir=/prysm-data --rpc-host=0.0.0.0 --monitoring-host=0.0.0.0 --http-web3provider=http://ropsten:8545 --jwt-secret=/ropsten-data/geth/jwtsecret --genesis-state=/prysm-data/genesis.ssz --ropsten --accept-terms-of-use
    ports:
      - 3500:3500
      - 4000:4000
      - 13000:13000
      - 12000:12000/udp
    volumes:
      - ./ropsten-data:/ropsten-data
      - ./prysm-data:/prysm-data
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime
    depends_on:
      - "ropsten"
  ropsten:
    image: ethereum/client-go:v1.10.19
    container_name: ropsten-test
    restart: unless-stopped
    command: --syncmode snap --datadir=/ropsten-data --ropsten --ws --ws.port 8545 --ws.api eth,net,web3,erigon,debug,ots,engine --ws.origins "*" --ws.addr 0.0.0.0 --http --http.api eth,net,web3,erigon,debug,ots,engine --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.port 8545 --http.corsdomain "*" --http.vhosts "*"
    volumes:
      - ./ropsten-data:/ropsten-data
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime
    ports:
      - 8545:8545
      - 30303:30303
I feel that this problem should be caused by the too low version of Ethereum in go.mod
Were you ever able to figure this out?
Some RPC requests will fail with this error when go-ethereum has not synced beyond block 2,675,000 (mainnet)
